content:
On behalf of CIIRC CTU I would like to invite you to the webinar on New Trends in AI in Central Europe, organized by the Czech Embassy of CZ in Tokyo on the occasion of the Czech Presidency of V4.
There will be speakers from all Visegrad countries. The Czech Republic will be represented by Tomáš Mikolov who recently joined the RICAIP team at CIIRC CTU.

:time: Thursday 18 June 2020, from 4:30 to 6:00 p.m. JST (i.e. 9:30 a.m. CET)
:right: free registration here: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=q8gL-se0sUOvIxgC0ZUHljPzr-e0bstPkyPgGp6GksZUMU5PN0UyRzdEWlpJUkE3OEoyNlVPTDUzSS4u

For more information visit: https://www.mzv.cz/tokyo/en/economy_and_trade/webinar_new_trends_in_ai_in_central.html

Webinar "New Trends in AI in Central Europe" on 18th June 2020
We would like to cordially invite interested participants to the webinar on <strong>New Trends in Artificial Intelligence in Central

In case you have missed the webinar New Trends in AI in Central Europe, organized by the Czech Embassy of CZ in Tokyo and want to learn more about this topic, watch the webinar recording: YouTube - Webinar New Trends in AI in Central Europe and Japan

Keynote lectures werepresented by four esteemed AI researchers from V4 countries, namely Dr. Tomáš Mikolov (AI Team Leader from the Czech Institute of Informatics, Robotics and Cybernetics in Prague), Dr. Péter Galambos (Director of Antal Bejczy Center for Intelligent Robotics at Óbuda University in Budapest), Mr. Robert Kroplewski (Plenipotentiary to the Minister of Digital Affairs of Poland) and Prof. Mária Bieliková (Chairperson of the Slovak Research Center for Artifical Intelligence - Slovak.AI).
